cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north-northwest toward the South Carolina coast this weekend, then curve northward through the Carolinas and mid-Atlantic states before turning east-northeast offshore early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast just north of Charleston / Myrtle Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from South Carolina northward to New Jersey, including Chesapeake Bay and Delmarva Peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with sustained winds 20–30 mph and gusts to 35 mph possible Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Baltimore’s inner harbor; minor tidal departures only
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Monday into early Tuesday with isolated ponding on terminal surfaces
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches; reduced visibility in heavy rain could disrupt vessel movements
